review.reviewBody: The giro ledge is by far the best bang for your buck helmet!! With a super simple style of helmet as-well as top of the line safety features!!!
review.name: GIRO LEDGE

review.reviewBody: This is an extremely good helmet, I would definitely recommend buying this helmet. Its super comfortable helmet. Another thing is it has the mips technology so you know that you will be safe. definitely recommend this helmet.
review.name: Great helmet

review.reviewBody: This helmet is overall a great helmet and very stylish and not too bulky, I recommend this helmet for any type of rider!
review.name: Giro ledge

review.reviewBody: Runs true to size, fitment is excellent! This is my second Giro Ledge MIPS Helmet. have both the white and autumn green. Helmet venting is okay at best so in turn it keeps your head warm. if you hate running hot, you may not like it and will want one with better ventilation.
review.name: Excellent Helmet!

review.reviewBody: Helmet is super comfortable, and fit true to size based on the size chart on the Backcountry website. Kept my head warm and protected while skiing in Vermont last weekend. Also worked seamlessly with goggles. MIPS technology is also a must have.
review.name: Loved this helmet

review.reviewBody: I LOVE this helmet. Its got the awesome looking bucket style but if I heavy head its not going to knock my goggles off my face. Also cant beat the MIPS. 11/10
review.name: Look good, feel safe!

review.reviewBody: This is my go to helmet. Primarily a park skier, the weight and comfortability of this helmet are two of my favorite things. Not sacrificing function for fashion, this helmet provides solid protection in and out of the park, not getting to hot or heavy when boot packing or touring. Highly recommend for anyone. Wether you are a beginner, or an expert, this helmet is for you.
review.name: Giro ledge helmet

review.reviewBody: I love all the giro helmets I've tried on, but the Ledge is the helmet I have worn for the last 7 years! The fit is unmatchable for my head, and the way it fits with giro goggles is seamless. I love that there are no painful trigger points, and that I can wear my skida headband underneath. I would never buy a helmet without MIPS technology, truly makes the world's difference as a big mountain skier. The ledge is lightweight, and comfortable in any weather condition! Highly recommend.
review.name: Amazing helmet!

review.reviewBody: I slammed almost head first into a tree according to ski patrol and a tracking app at about 45mph this last winter. I was wearing this helmet when I did, and I came out of it with a concussion only. Without a helmet on I would have died or been much more severely injured, and this is the helmet that made sure I got to the hospital and back in my bed at home that evening. It might be on the cheaper end and not have as many features, but it will keep that mushy melon in between your ears safe so you can shred another day.
review.name: Saved my head and maybe my life

name: Ledge Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: Great base layer for wearing under my kor air shell warm on cold days for hiking.
review.name: Nice vest

review.reviewBody: I was expecting a little more insulation. This vest is lightweight windproof and does a good job of keeping your body heat in the vest. Also great for layering with other jackets. However when I get in my cold car, I can feel the cold seat penetrating the vest.
review.name: Good for layering.

review.reviewBody: Bought the Kor vest a couple months ago and thus far it has proven to be a great garment. I wanted a lighter weight vest to provide wind blockage and a bit of warmth which would be worn over assorted base clothing and it has perfectly filled that bill. I’m surprised at the warmth it affords for the thinness of the vest. I’m 6’, 195#, and the large fits perfectly and will comfortably accommodate a T-shirt or fleece base layer. Extremely pleased with my purchase.
review.name: Great Vest

review.reviewBody: The airmesh inside combined with the kor shell thin outside is the perfect combo for a lightweight breathable vest! Best vest I’ve owned and the fit is perfect for layering
review.name: Simply the best

review.reviewBody: The is vest is nicely constructed with four pockets.  It is light weight and perfect for traveling.
review.name: Perfect light weight vest

review.reviewBody: Great lightweight vest for all occasions. Warm enough for moderately cold days.
review.name: Great lightweight vest for all occasions

review.reviewBody:
It’s been awhile since I’ve used a pair of laced boots and let’s just say I was pleasantly surprised. These boots are very comfortable, lock in the ankle nicely and provide a great all-around stiffness. The tread on these suckers are great and sturdy enough you’ll find me hoofing a few ridge lines in them. 

I’d size up 1/2 size from your typical boot size
review.name: Great Boot

name: Hi-Standard Pro Snowboard Boot - 2025

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This shoe has been amazing for my child. He learned to walk best in these. His toes are protected. And they are just adorable! Everyone asks us what they are and all of our friends and family are getting them for their kids! Hands down the best, most comfortable and supportive shoe. My son has multiple shoes and he only wears these. He even crawls to get them and hands them to us to go outside. He doesn’t do that with any other shoe. Also they are great for wide feet because they are adjustable and forgiving.
review.name: Best first walker/toddler shoe

hasVariant.name: Hard 40qt Cooler
hasVariant.description: Buy the Snow Peak Hard 40qt Cooler online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I made several purchases with Backcountry and they were all delivered to a neighbor about 10 houses down. They were kind enough to bring them my house and we notified the shipping company of the error. Al my orders were accounted for with the exception of the cooler. I attempted to file a police report as requested by Backcountry. The local Sherriff department said due to the price being under $500 they are unable to file a report or investigate, but they will document the incident in case any others in the neighborhood have missing packages. I emailed Backcountry multiple times and they quit responding.
review.name: Never Received, so I’m unable to review.
comment: We sincerely apologize for the difficulties you've experienced with your recent orders and the missing cooler. We understand your frustration with the delivery errors and our lack of response. We've sent you an email to discuss this situation further and find a resolution.

name: Hard 40qt Cooler

review.reviewBody: Fit, look, comfort, stiffness, function, color (black), ventilation, all excellent.  I especially like the dual BOA fasteners and the replaceable heel.  Plus, these are usually pretty expensive, and still are expensive, but I got a great discounted price here.
review.name: Fantastic road shoes!

review.reviewBody: You'd expect a great shoe for this price, but I still had my reservations. The shoe was initially stiff but has broken in nicely. It remains exceptionally light and responsive.
review.name: Better Than Expected

review.reviewBody: These are very narrow. They do have a wide version but it appears they don't make those in a 47 which is what I would likely need. As such, I did not wear them to ride so I can't give that feedback. One feedback from a design perspective is that the solid base doesn't extend the entire length of the shoe such that the soft material is exposed in the middle of the shoe. If you had the luxury of only using these for racing that's not a problem but I would be using these for daily training as well and as such walking a bit is necessary. I would worry about the durability in that regard.
review.name: Very narrow - had to return

review.reviewBody: Lives up to hype - lightweight, good fit without insert as I have high instep, carbon increases pedal power and took 1/2 size smaller than my SIDIs.
review.name: Great Rode Shoe

review.reviewBody: Shoe is well made but too narrow if your foot runs wide. The adjustability of the dials is nice and allows the user to get a precise fit.
review.name: Nice Shoe - Too Narrow

review.reviewBody: First time purchasing a Shimano road shoe so I didn't know what to expect. True to size length wise, but the toe box seems really roomy to me. For me that was both good and bad. Good because it makes the shoe more comfortable in my opinion, and bad because with the stock insoles I was constantly tightening the dials to try and get a really snug fit. Eventually went to insoles that took up more room and that solved my problem. Really like the adjustment dials as you can really fine tune the fit and it's easy to do while on the bike.
review.name: Comfort and Performance

review.reviewBody: purchased after having numerous issues with Fizik and other brands that were too tight. The fit is great and comfortable over long rides. Good arch support and the boa dials allow for perfect adjustment and easy to do on rides. The feeling of the power transfer is the biggest improvement over my previous entry level carbon shoes.
review.name: Great shoe and fit

review.reviewBody: Comfortable  and so light that I thought the box  was empty when I received them.
review.name: love my new S-phyre

review.reviewBody: I've ridden in shimano shoes for over 10 years, but never had RC9's. I must say, this shoe is definitely worth it. The fit is spot on and the boa's snug everything up nicely and have great adjustment so I can get them to feel exactly how I want them to. Also, the toe box seems to be roomier compared to the RC7's I was using, which is a welcomed change. Very nice venting, but not too breathable where my feet are cold on chillier days. I've used them for everthing from long road rides and gravel, to the occasional singletrack secteurs. Durable, stiff, great fit, and amazing looks. Honestly, what more could you ask for out of cycling shoes? I'd say Shimano has really outdone themselves with these S-PHYRES!
review.name: Favorite Shoe to Date

review.reviewBody: I have used always SIDI brand wish is a great brand overall. But the RC903 S-PHYRE is the best cycling shoe its worth each dollar you pay for it. Lightweight, comfortable for long ride in you bike. I would buy it again and it’s 100% recommended
review.name: Best road shoes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This jacket is very well made.  The lining isn't too thin or too think, but is just right for a moderaltely cold, wet day.  Very cozy.  Love the style, very cute.  Perfect rain jacket.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits well, true to size, very pretty color with the vibrant coral color on top, does show dirt easily, but also very easy to clean off with even a damp paper towel if you are out. Like that there's a liner. Lightweight. Good for warmer rainy days. Would need something heavier for 40 or below.

review.reviewBody: Works as advertised.  I couldn't receive messages for a few days when I was testing it from home but then started receiving them. review.itemreviewed: Windstopper Base Layer Long Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Size is true for US - XL. Fits perfect.  Not tight sleeve cuffs like some.  I have several different base layers to choose from on cold mornings.  This is the one.
review.name: My Favorite Baselayer

review.itemreviewed: Windstopper Base Layer Long Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody:
It works extraordinarily well for such a light layer.  I often pack it "just in case" as it's lighter than a shell and breaths significantly better.  It's very snug and I'll need a couple of seconds to throw it on under whatever jersey I'm wearing, but it's totally worth it.   

I mostly wear it mountain biking around Utah.
review.name: One of my favorite spring/fall layers

review.itemreviewed: Windstopper Base Layer Long Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Definitely a cycling-oriented base layer, the windstopper membrane covers the front of the shirt, and the back is a more traditional stretchy breathable mesh. The main issue I have with the shirt is that the windstopper material, while it performs well, has some undesirable qualities. It's quite loud/swooshy, and doesn't have very much stretch to it, so even though the shirt fits tightly, the fabric bunches as forms these awkward rolls/accordion flaps when you bend your arms or twist with the garment on. Kinda odd looking. The interior of the shirt is not the most comfortable, and next-to-skin comfort is definitely important if you're going to call this a base layer. I haven't experienced any real chafing yet, but I'm never exactly excited to pull this shirt on.

Functionally, it definitely gets the job done. It helps cut the wind a lot, and paired with a mid-weight thermal jersey I've felt quite warm down to about 45*F/7*C. It's also very lightweight for how much warmth it provides. The back panels help keep you from overheating, but you obviously wouldn't want to throw this on for sunny ride on a warm day.

The sizing definitely runs small, I'm 6'1/165lbs and the Large is very fitted, and I definitely would be bummed if I bought a Medium. Be sure to check the size chart - the sizing of the shirt is accurate to the chart, but the sizes themselves are smaller than most Americans might be used to.
review.name: Warm, but check the sizing chart
comment: Thank you for writing such a thorough review. Very helpful.

name: Windstopper Base Layer Long Sleeve Shirt - Men's

description: Buy the Leatt MTB 4.0 AllMtn Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: MTB 4.0 AllMtn Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the Leatt MTB 4.0 AllMtn Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Originally bought size L, as it starts at 23.3 in and I have a 24in headband... thing was massive, even tightened all the way it wouldnt fit. Since exchanging for a medium, fits much better. It is still a pretty thick helmet, better for more aggressive riders as its probably a bit much for most riders. Airflow is decent considering how large it is. Not crashed in it but seems to provide a lot of protection, and the bigger lining is comfortable.
review.name: 3.5 star, go down if size is close

review.reviewBody:
Upgraded from a 3.0 to this and couldn't be more disappointed.  The retention dial broke and fell apart after just a handful of rides rendering the helmet completely useless.

I purchased the helmet early in the year and didn't get to ride much due to the very wet spring in Colorado this year.  Unfortunately, that means that the helmet was past the 30 day return window for Backcountry when it failed.

Hopefully Backcountry will do the right thing and resolve this equipment failure.
review.name: Extremely Disappointing
comment: Contact Leatt.  They?ll likely warranty it and will directly contact Backcountry if needed.

review.reviewBody:
Bought the 3.0 and this one (4.0). The quality and fit seemed very good for this range of MTB helmets. Adjustment was easy and fit was very good. Returning because it is a bit heavier than the 3.0 and was more protection than I probably need doing slower, technical riding. 

These helmets (Leatt) appear to fit more oval-shaped domes.

Wasn't overly impressed by the eyeware on-board storage but I also didn't try very hard to make my Smith Longfins attach easily.
review.name: Serious Helmet

review.reviewBody: This thing is massive! Very nice looking, but way too huge! Sticks off the head more than any helmet I have owned. I was super disappointed in how grande this helmet fit because of how awesome it looks. I wanted to keep it, but I knew my riding buddies would ridicule me with endless Space Balls jokes... It's that big!
review.name: Look out Dark Helmet!

name: MTB 4.0 AllMtn Helmet

description: Buy the Cotopaxi Allpa Del Dia 42L Travel Pack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Allpa Del Dia 42L Travel Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Cotopaxi Allpa Del Dia 42L Travel Pack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: It’s got beauty and function. I’m excited to take it on its first international trip.
review.name: Love this pack!

review.reviewBody: It’s beautiful and well made. Water bottle pockets are perfect size and easy to reach.
review.name: New travel bag

review.reviewBody: We love our travel Pack. It helps organize everything for efficient travel!
review.name: Fun and practical.

review.reviewBody: The product is excellent. Hands-free luggage is always appreciated and it’s well supported by weight distribution.
review.name: The product is excellent. Hands-free

review.reviewBody: I have purchased 6 of these now. They make traveling by plane so easy. I’ve taken this size on weeklong trips where extra shoes and snorkeling gear was packed. I’ve taken them on long weekend getaways with full winter gear, including snow boots and bibs. You can stuff a lot into them and it always fits in the overhead bin. Love the colors too!
review.name: Our sixth one

review.reviewBody: Love the functionality of this bag. Pocket for water bottle. Different compartments. My compression bags fit perfectly inside. Had plenty of room in the overhead compartment of the plane
review.name: The perfect travel bag

review.reviewBody: I've been looking for a good weekend pack for my scouts campouts and this is perfect!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: This bag was better than I expected. I had originally thought that a bag this large with a backpack style would be too heavy for me. It was just perfect. I was able to easily carry it through the airport. I expect this will be a staple in travel where I don’t want to have wheels. It drives me crazy to be hopping in and out of trains or across rough terrain with a wheeled carry-on. Now I have the space for what I need, packaged in a sustainably made and beautiful bag.
review.name: Perfect for travel

review.reviewBody: Love the Del dia line - so much easier to spot your bag with unique colour combos.
review.name: Amazing colour combination!

review.reviewBody: Darker slightly than the show images on the Del Dia color selection page - not a bad thing at all, in fact i like it more than i thought i would already, as i was hesitant on the yellow hip part on mine at first, but it appears more safety yellow than highlighter yellow.
review.name: Big and Beautiful

name: Allpa Del Dia 42L Travel Pack

description: Buy the Thule Wheel Strap - 2-Pack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Wheel Strap - 2-Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Wheel Strap - 2-Pack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit.  I wasn't exactly sure of the year or model of my roof rack and this strap fit perfectly in the cradle!
review.name: Wheel Strap

review.reviewBody: Thule fully supports their products.  The Wheel Strap was easy to purchase on the site.  It took me less than 15 minutes to find and buy.  It was delivered to my mailbox in less than a week, and it was very easy to replace the broken wheel straps!!!  The wheel straps are heavy duty, and I cracked the original due to my own mistake.  I purchased the Thule Rack from a car dealership, and they could not replace the part.
review.name: Thule Wheel Strap Review

review.reviewBody: Item was exactly what I needed and was shipped in a timely manner
review.name: Perfect Replacement parts

review.reviewBody: My roof mount is old and I have no idea what model, but these worked perfectly.  Took a little work to get them on, but they are snug and secure so I have no concerns. They are much better and more ergonomic than the old brittle ones I had to replace. Thank you Thule for making this a simple fix and not requiring the purchase of an entire new system!
review.name: Fits great

review.reviewBody:
I have an older roof rack, and when my wheel strap broke due to dry rot, I thought I was at a loss, plus not knowing the model number of my roof rack. So I took a chance and ordered what I thought was a good fit and Booooom it was! 

Thanks for keeping me on the road Thule
review.name: Wheel strap

review.reviewBody: I was looking for these straps for awhile until going to Thule actual website and voila, they had it. Best choice ever, so excited with my purchase!
review.name: Work like a charm!

review.reviewBody: Nice to know that products can be replaced with the same type after 10 years. Had to replace the clamp due to sun damage and usage after 10 years of southern Californian sun.
review.name: Would buy from again

name: Wheel Strap - 2-Pack

review.reviewBody:
Ive run these for a season or two now and I love them, super light, strong and sweet looking!
I've had numerous rocks thrown up hard by the front tire hit the cranks and leave a ding or two but otherwise, nothing major! 
These are also damn stiff and feel good when pedaling hard. What I also like is that you can change spindles to fit different bike dimensions.
Price is the only part that hurts but you get what you pay for and these have the strength to weight ratio to make that price understandable.
review.name: Rad Cranks

review.reviewBody: I've had next cranks for years because I keep getting them warrantied. If you sickly ride just down hill they might last more than a year but if you do any kind of climbing they will come un bonded from the aluminum and you will have floppy crank arms and some sore knees. I can't believe they haven't figured it out yet.
review.name: No stars
comment: Another anecdote. I am 5' 11"and for most of the time I have had my Next SL cranks (4 years) I weighed 200 lbs.  In  those years I  rode about 11,900 miles in the Santa Cruz mountains, no shuttles.  The cranks are as solid as the day I bought them. My main suggestion though is to get a compatible third party preload adjuster ring (such as sold by Cane Creek).  The plastic Raceface part is just not durable and I stripped many before buying the (vastly) better part.

name: Next R Crank Arms

review.reviewBody:
Unfortunately I wore these a couple of days and feel I could have used a bigger size.
They are not very comfortable. I called Sorel to see if I could return and exchange but was told no. So now I have a pair of uncomfortable sneaks I cannot wear.

comment: Hello cjones, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Low WP Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am very impressed with this shoe. I live a very cold, snowy climate and we had a surprise early snow and my boots were still in storage from a move. I hiked through deep snow in these for over an hour and my feet stayed perfectly warm and dry. I bought these as a winter work (indoor) shoe and never expected they would be such a high performing outdoor shoe as well. I will be buying more in the future.
review.name: Waterproof and warm!

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Low WP Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: Wanted to keep them. They were very cute and fit but rubbed on my heel
review.name: Cute but rubbed heal

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Low WP Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the look and feel of these shoes. The sole of the shoe is very supportive and comfortable. HOWEVER BUT back of the heal (counter/foxing) digs into the back of top ankle. I don't know if it the pitch of the material or what. I did meaure if it came up higher than other sneakers and it is not.  I'm not trying to not tighten the to see if that help but then the front of my shoe is loose. I brought these for europe and going to take them as an option if it rains.  I'd suggest they look at how the heal counter area is really designed.
review.name: All but the Heal
comment: Hello Swimtams, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry OUT N ABOUT™ IV Low Women's Waterproof Sneaker didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.itemreviewed: Out N About IV Low WP Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: comfy waterproof shoe with a fun look, I took off one star for lack of arch support. They could use some.
review.name: Comfy and cute

review.reviewBody: Currently in my kitchen with a double rack from 0 to 4, double nuts and a set of hexes, helmet shoes harness, etc etc inside, and an 80m rope strapped to the outside. When you don’t carry a rack the rope can live inside. You won’t need to carry more than that unless you’re living on the wall. It’s a little disappointing that there is no way to stow straps in case you want to haul it without catching on everything, but I suppose that means it’s more comfortable on the approach. Routinely carry 40+lbs of nonsense around Jtree and Sierra crags, essentially guiding friends. Love that you can use it as a tarp, and load it like a tube. This is my go to cragging dumpster, but it won’t be replacing a haul bag any time soon.
review.name: Can’t stash straps to haul but otherwise perfect

review.reviewBody: I’ve had the backpack for about a month now and I love it. It’s designed to be used as a crag pack for climbing but I use it for technical rescue gear and clothes. The side pouches are excellent for organizing everything. Couldn’t be happier.
review.name: Unintended usage

review.reviewBody: When I first got this pack I was a bit underwhelmed.  The shape, the features, etc. were all a bit foreign to me having used more traditional climbing packs.  Having used it a few weeks now, it has really grown on me.  The things I found odd are now beginning to make sense and are actually well thought out.  I never thought I would use the multiple ways of accessing the inside, yet I do...on every outing.  The fat, flat shape that I found a bit unappealing is perfect for keeping the bag upright, haul bag style.  I might choose a different pack if I had a mult-hour approach, but for nearby cragging and ventures to the gym, I think it's perfect.
review.name: Slow Burn

review.reviewBody: I bought the pack about a month ago to replace my old beat up crag pack. This pack is perfect for bouldering to sport days. We’ll thought out design and organization, and the full zip open design is amazing. Minimizes yard saling. Only note, for better or worse, is al the webbing straps are SUPER long. Easy to cut shorter or tuck away if needed. Can’t recommend this pack enough.
review.name: Best pack around

review.reviewBody:
I recently bought the Tower 47 to replace a haul bag-style crag bag and am very happy I did.  My previous pack swallowed up a lot of gear with just enough organization to keep my snack from getting smashed by my rack but it just didn’t fit my shape very well.  This is a common theme for me and a big reason I have more MR packs in regular rotation than anything else.
The Tower 47 will easily carry a double rack with some extra bits plus a dozen draws, my personal kit (harness, belay, rescue), a helmet, a couple of liters of water, snacks, a guide book and a somewhat bulky first aid kit.  I can hang a pair of shoes from one of the daisy chains on the outside and strap a lap coiled rope across the lid.  Everything carries neatly and has a place to go and the suspension makes it comfortable to carry all day.
I love how I can put it down, pull my harness out through an external zipper, open the entire bag up and out to get access to everything else I want in any order that I want it.  It’s taken a few weekends of cragging to get it dialed the way I want it and I still have a bit of dead space inside that I can pack more efficiently but it’s much better than my last tube.  It pairs really well with a rope tarp or maybe two rope tarps, one to open the bag up on and one for the rope.  It carries a coiled rope so nicely that it has made my rope bag obsolete.
I’ve added the MR Wingman MultiPocket to carry an extra liter of water since it’s been so hot lately, it makes a good spot to stash the things I want quickly that I’ll too easily put off using if it isn’t close at hand.
review.name: My favorite crag pack yet!

review.reviewBody: Tower 47 pack is hefty and good for tugging up with a rope when doing multipitch climb.
review.name: Interesting design

review.reviewBody:
I use this bag for guiding and it's awesome! I love that the entire bad zips open so I can easily fit a rope in the bag and access everything I need all at once rather than pulling things out one-by-one from the top.

The back is very adjustable so you can size the bag to your exact torso length. The inside has two large gear loops to attach draws, etc. and there are several compartments to help keep things organized. One of the side compartments even opens from the inside and outside (I usually put my sunscreen there). The large handles on the top and side of the bag are great for lifting it. Several loops on the front for clipping extra gear on the outside of the bag if needed. I've only been using it a couple weeks but seems pretty durable so far. I'm super happy with it!
review.name: This bag is great!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this bag about a month ago. I don’t use it for its intended purpose of rock climbing. I work for the fire department and I’m always on the go to different fire stations. This bag is great  because of the amount of room and ease of accessing all of the contents. It seems extremely durable. I’m super happy with it so far.
review.name: Perfect Bag

review.reviewBody:
I've been using this at the ice climbing park and love being able to organize all my kit in the internal pockets and then fillet it all open at the park for quick access. It's burly that I don't worry about picks or ice screws damaging it and big enough to fit extra stuff that you might not take alpine style. I'm 6' and 175lbs and the S/M fits me. 
Only reason for not 5 star is there's no ice tool holders on the outside.
review.name: Comfortable big stuffer. Built in burrito pocket!

review.reviewBody: This is a great Crag pack.  It is very well thought and allows for loading and unloading options.  The ability to unzip the belly of the pack is incredibly convenient, quick access, and the vented pockets allow you to see contents and organization.  I am able to put all of my sport climbing equipment, 3 pairs of shoes, food, water, and rope internally and if the pack is full of gear, you put your rope on the flat top and cinch it down.  The pack carries well and is comfortable.  I have been looking for a crag pack like this for 20 years.
review.name: Crag Pack

name: Tower 47L Daypack

hasVariant.description: Buy the Reima Vantti Softshell Jacket- Girls' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Favorite cool weather jacket - comfortable, warm enough, water resistant enough for the wet sprinkles we get all day. 

Especially love the zipper that’s easy for little hands to use themselves. Some jackets the zipper always gets caught. Never on this one! 

Great fit, we are on year two of wearing the same jacket.
review.name: Favorite cool weather jacket

review.reviewBody: Our house is in front of the lake so jackets became my kids favs since the beginning of summer holidays! Wind is not a problem any more, they just wear these above the T-shirts and go for morning and evening walks safely! Great quality and absolutely fantastic prints! We love it!
review.name: Our house is in front

review.reviewBody: Absolutely great and quality jackets this a second time I bought a water-repellent softshell jacket for my grand-daughter and she loves them, this time she chose blue. Thank you Reima.
review.name: Vantti blue

review.reviewBody: This jacket is just perfect. I’m buying this jacket for a friends’ child. My son already has one and I’m about to buy one more in other colour. It’s very high quality and very durable. The old one my 7-years son has it’s almost as new. I would strongly recommend this jacket for autumn, lighter winters and spring time. My kiddo loves it and wears it all the time! Thank you Reima!
review.name: Wonderful jacket!

review.reviewBody: This is the highest quality most unique item I have seen for kids. With this jacket on... bring on the weather. Rain, Cold, Snow, no matter the conditions this tough jacket will keep them dry and happy.
review.name: Best Kids light weight coat.

review.reviewBody: Second time ordering this jacket for my son. The first one he had wore so well - planning on handing it down, and it's still pretty much in mint condition. This is his second, and I'm so glad to rely on such a reliable, stylish product.
review.name: Great kid jacket!

review.reviewBody: This jacket fits my slim build son perfectly- size 122; 48lbs, almost 7 years old and on the tall side. It keeps him dry, allows him to move and is super cute. We love it. It is good quality and keeps up on all of our adventures.
review.name: Great all around outer layer

review.reviewBody: Really liked the feel of this jacket. Soft, slightly stretchy and slim fitting. However we didn't keep it as I felt like it ran small or perhaps true to size and wouldn't be easy for my preschooler to get on/off independently while wearing layers at his outdoor school. Would be a great spring coat with 1 shirt underneath but this coat was a recipe for 'my sweater sleeves are bunched up' tantrums in our young child.
review.name: Stylish and slim fitting. Not great for layers

review.reviewBody: The size was a little snug for my two year old but a really fantastic mid season jacket
review.name: The size was a little

review.reviewBody: These are great pants and so far seem to be very durable and high quality. My toddler is in outdoor preschool so they get a lot of wear in wet conditions. They have proved to be waterproof. Sometimes they are completely soaked but the inside is still fairly dry. I'm satisfied! The only issue I experienced with this particular item is the sizing seems to be off. My son is 4 years old and I usually order that size in this brand due to Reima's extra sizing for growth. That was not the case for this jacket. I had to go up 2 sizes to a 6 y/o and I'm doubtful he will be able to wear it another season.
review.name: Perfect for fall and wet conditions!

name: Vantti Softshell Jacket- Girls'

review.reviewBody: Very nice shoes but fit vert small compared to my size.
review.name: Nice shoes

review.reviewBody: (Purchased 27/11/24). Nice warm boots, good inner fleece. Study outsole and ok grip on the trails. The biggest issue I came across (in my experience) is the upper as it is not waterproof. It got wet in the rain unfortunately and did soak through. It did take the rain a while to seep in but if you plan on being out all day in wet weather in these then they won’t keep your feet dry. As I got these on sale I’m relatively ok with this purchase but if I would of paid full price for these I would of been disappointed.
review.name: Water resistant, not waterproof

Unfortunately I have found the sole is extremely prone to slipping on wetter surfaces, iv nearly stacked it a few times walking along in the rain

review.reviewBody: These are super comfortable but no matter how fast or slow a walk, my gait or what socks I wear they soles make a pronounced snapping sound. It is very distracting for me, and anyone walking with me. It is so distracting that I cannot wear them.  I’ve looked for solutions but nothing works.
review.name: My Outsnaps Literally Snap
comment: Hi. We’re sorry for any inconvenience. We’re glad to confirm that a case has been opened to address your concerns, and we’re waiting for your answer. Please check your inbox!

review.reviewBody: Inner sole has come lose, poor lacing design creates pressure points, and poor lacing makes "waterproofing" basically useless. If I could return it would but unfortunately this is all I can do.
review.name: Avoid
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: These boots are awesome for around town winter days. This is my 3rd pair. These boots are extremely light, comfortable and warm. Im glad they still offer them. I like the colors they used with these as well. They are super easy to clean. Wipe with a damp cloth and they look new again. Keep making them Salomon!
review.name: Great around town winter boots!

review.reviewBody: Fits true to size.  Very lightweight and athletic for a winter boot.  I use for day hikes and disc golf.  Good for winter hikes around the city or parks.  Great if you're looking for a winter boot that's light enough to move around some miles in through the snow.  If you're doing some heavy duty labor all day long in frigid temperatures I would opt for a more heavy duty boot as these insulated but only to a moderate amount and are designed for speed and comfort first.
review.name: Comfortable hybrid winter boot/shoe

review.reviewBody: Got my new pair today in the Brown colour I love this shoe ultra light and so so comfy perfect boot for autumn winter, kind of a sock like fit like the pulsar 2 trail pro I have This shoe feels featherlight for a boot but still feels Solid. Think I will be wearing this casually and in the mountains. I Love it !
review.name: Love This Shoe

review.reviewBody: Was looking for a light, waterproof shoe with ankle support for long walks. This is it! Outstanding comfort from the first wear
review.name: Perfect shoe!

review.reviewBody: Purchased these and put them on for my first long walk. Great fit, true to size, very comfy and warm... Only issue is how slippy the soles are - not brilliant which is a shame.
review.name: very good fit, but soles are very slippy

name: Outsnap CS WP Boot - Men's

hasVariant.name: High Coast Foldsack 24L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven High Coast Foldsack 24L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great lightweight bag, comfortable to wear but the zipper on the bag is not great.  You have to squeeze the zipper area to try to get the bag zipped.
review.name: Zipper is terrible

review.reviewBody: The hoops where the top flap latches are too loose and it constantly unlatches. Also the zipper for the top/main compartment frequently catches on the bags material, making it impossible to open. I have had the bag for a week and am already looking for replacement. Very disappointing buy!
review.name: Terrible waste.

review.reviewBody: Quite happy with this bag. Except for the side pockets that are totally useless the minute the back is full. Can’t put anything in there.  A mesh or stretchy fabric would be way more suitable.
review.name: Perfect but not so perfect…

review.reviewBody: Comfortable backpack, I use it for work and it's held up amazingly well.  The only issue I have is with the main compartment zipper getting jammed.
review.name: Great Bag, for every day.

review.reviewBody:
I was really happy with this product when I first purchased it. My previous hiking back I purchased from them is still going strong after 10 years of use. 

However I would not recommend this product. As others have also experienced the interior lining has started delaminated after just one year of use. Really disappointing from a brand that prides itself on sustainability....
review.name: Water proof lining disintegrating

review.reviewBody: Had mine a couple of months and I love it. I can get everything I need in and so comfortable too.
review.name: Fabulous

review.reviewBody:
Very useful, light and a lot of space for such a little backpack.
Good material.

One issue is zipper, when fully opened it get stuck, also it is impossible to close the zipper with one hand.

I solved the issue by making a block few centimeters from end, so the zipper cannot be moved to the far opened position.
review.name: Great with zipper issue

review.reviewBody:
This daypack is a well-rounded minimal travel daypack. One large compartment that is expandable. Folds down flat so it can be packed. Comes with a couple of well placed straps for compression and stability (sternum strap). The bottom is made of a more durable material. It's not too hard to pack and make this backpack stand on its own. Looks great too!

Small con: bottle side pockets can be hard to use if pack is full. Maybe stretchy side pockets would work better.

Would suggest Fjallraven team explore two-tone color options in the future.
review.name: Light, packable and comfortable travel daypack

review.reviewBody: I grabbed this with the intention of it being an addition to my bike set up. I was torn between this bag and the Abisko Hike Foldsack but decided upon this one because it rolls up and can easily store on my bike during transit. On my way home with groceries I can unroll it and won't have to worry about stuffing everything into my handle bar bag. Overall I am biased to say I love all Fjallraven items and have not purchased anything from them that has let me down.
review.name: Foldsack that rolls up!

review.reviewBody: The zipper gets stocked at the beginning. I took it for repair and they say all bags are like this! Not very comfortable to have to deal with the zipper every time. Also, the bag hurts my back when carrying just my laptop. Overall, not comfortable!
review.name: Not comfortable

name: High Coast Foldsack 24L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable but would like more underfoot cushioning. Need to change inner sole to be ideal.
review.name: Comfortable but needs better insole
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These have been my go to hiking shoes for decades. I hike 3+ times per week and they never let me down. I have twice tried more expensive boots thinking I might be missing something only to go back to the Merrell Moab boots.  I've recommended them to many people and they are never disappointed.
review.name: Reliable, comfortable, and cost effective.

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Fantastic all rounder!  From walking the dog to hiking on rocky or slippery terrain these are just the absolute best.
review.name: Merrell Junkie!

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable out of the box.  Looking forward to taking them on my next trip.
review.name: Moab 3

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great fit. Nice grooves grab leaves or any debris. Didn’t get a chance to break them in before hike and they still were comfortable the entire way. Highly recommend.
review.name: Woodsy hike approved
comment: Thank you for sharing your review with us.

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: My go to hiking boots for the last 10 years! They are great in so many ways, but when you push in the tongue to lace them, the tongue rubs on the front of your foot every step you take. I tried moving it around to find a good fit, but I never could.. my solution was to just not tie as tight, but then I had a little less ankle support. Just finished hiking in Peru and they were waterproof as we went though many puddles, low river crossings, and rain.
review.name: Great Boot --close to perfect, but one issue

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Needed to replace my old hiking shoes (also Merrells). Knew I was going to a place with snow, sand, and rugged terrain. Wanted something sturdy, comfortable and waterproof. Aside from stepping into mid-calf water my shoes were dry for a week of hard use. Required no break in time. They dried fast after my water incident. Good grip. No blisters from rubbing wrong. Love these
review.name: Great for all terrain adventures

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These replaced my other Merrell boots which honestly went for years! They are so comfortable and supportive, I've used them in the snow, hiking, through streams and scrambling. An allrounder for me.
review.name: Comfortable, supportive allrounder

review.itemreviewed: Moab 3 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am very happy with my Moab 3 Mid GORE-TEX. I went on a hike and they felt great. I live in the area of Western North Carolina where Helene did a lot of destruction. I have worn them everyday during clean up. I have been dragging limbs and small trees on uneven ground and had no trouble keeping my balance. Love them.
review.name: sturdiness

name: Moab 3 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: My 19 y/o college son wanted a forearm trainer to have in his dorm and this one is perfect! It’s tiny but it is definitely a forearm workout. I tried it myself and was impressed.
review.name: Tiny but mighty

review.reviewBody: I have had several of these Forearm Trainers for years, some I have given away as gifts, some I have lost, all I have used and relied upon. Aside from research showing that grip strength is related to health and longevity, It is an easy-to-carry piece of exercise equipment, has no issues with travel restrictions around the world and has remained a classic over the decades. I keep one in each vehicle and my travel packs.
review.name: Lifelong Travel Partner

review.reviewBody: A great tool to keep in the car to destress and work your forearms while communting.
review.name: Forearm Trainer

review.reviewBody: The forearm trainer is a great tool to use while sitting in meetings or watching TV.
review.name: Great Tool

review.reviewBody: Good while it lasted, but broke completely through on one side and is now useless.
review.name: Mine broke

review.reviewBody: After using this for a couple times, I can tell my forearms are already adjusting. Really easy to grip, great resistance, and fantastic results. One thing that I would've liked is the opportunity to stick all your fingers in the middle of the donut and use finger strength to expand it: that's pretty niche but otherwise it's a perfect product for me!
review.name: Great for my forearms!

review.reviewBody: I keep this on the coffee table to work out a little bit while I’m watching tv. Overall it’s a great trainer: light, compact, and effective. Would buy again.
review.name: Great little forearm trainer

review.reviewBody: Purchased for my son to work on his grip. We both enjoy them as he get ready for climbing. I higly recommend.
review.name: Trainer

review.reviewBody: great trainer for the fore arms. My elbow feels much better after using it. Thanks
review.name: Give me strength

review.reviewBody: I use these in my middle school class as achievements gifts. Kids love them! Great size. I’ve tried cheaper ones online but they are generally much smaller.
review.name: Great side item

review.reviewBody: These have been awesome to use on all of my bike rides. and I love the color way!
review.name: I am so happy I bought these!

review.reviewBody: I like the wider toe box. It’s nice not to have my toes crunched up. Super comfortable shoes!
review.name: Toe box awesome

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use these for spin class. The upper is flexible and breathable. I leave off the laces to better accommodate an inflexible big toe joint. The velcro strap holds them on just fine. They will be easy to rinse out and fast to dry when needed.
review.name: Very comfortable and good value

review.reviewBody: Didn’t wear these , not my size . These are women’s shoes.
review.name: I had to return these shoes they were not my size.

review.reviewBody: I never review but compelled this time. 40 yr Mtn biker. A cleat option creates too much slide on a platform pedal. No firm rubber insert as an option with purchase, if you switch between clipless and platform pedals. Also, shoelaces surprisingly low quality.
review.name: Comfortable but lacks full function

review.reviewBody: I have the original trail cross  hiking and mtbiking shoes in size 10.5, and they are great, but these are very narrow in size 11. That means that they are not comfortable for ride.
review.name: perfectbut to narrow in comparison to the original

review.reviewBody: Great fit! Lots of wiggle room for my toes. I've had problems with other bike shoes having a really shallow toe box. These shoes don't have that issue. The sole is stiff for good power transfer but they are still comfy to walk in. I like the combination of laces plus velcro. It's easy to get the perfect amount of stability and also easy to get the shoes off and on quickly. I ride mostly around the city with a lot of stops for shopping plus some longer rides on gravel or paved surface.  The sizing is true to American athletic shoe sizing. Great bike shoe overall. So glad I found them.
review.name: Finally, bike shoes I did not have to return

name: Trailcross Clip-In Cycling Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I recently wore these for a trekking trip and had no pain. These are better for those with wide feet and who need a softer sole. It's a true road to trails shoe if you will be running/walking on both.
review.name: Wide and Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I have os navicularis, so a cushioned shoe is imperative. This is one of the few that actually are. I experienced no pain during a week-long trekking trip. Addtionally, no moisture came in after walking in mud for miles. They are pretty bulky, so I don't know if they are the greatest running shoe, but I definitely recommend for walking.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody:
At first try on I noticed they are noisy.  The mesh makes as a little noise.  I thought it would go away after a few runs, but it hasn’t.  
It also has internal stitching near the top shoelace holes that rub after a few miles.  Additionally the top shoelace hole has a metal cover.  Why? 
I’m sure when I bought the description said Mixed terrain, it now shows smooth.  So what is it?  

Fit is true to size.  Cushion is good.  
Unfortunately, I’m not sure this is going to work for some the longer trail runs this fall.  
Wish I could return or exchange for another trail shoe.
review.name: Wish I could return.
comment: Hi. We’re sorry for any inconvenience. We’re glad to confirm to you that a case has been opened to address your concerns, and we’re waiting for your answer. Please check your inbox!

review.reviewBody: Straight out of the box these didn't feel right - not much support in the footbed, low heel and upper is very thin and not supportive.  They'd be a great shoe for road running, but not high intensity trail running.  Not sure if I could rely on these to support me in rocky terrain or grip mud.  Had to return...
review.name: Light and strange!
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.reviewBody: This shoe is great for hiking in muddy-puddly Oregon! My feet stay dry and warm. Nice cushioning, and I love the reverse lugs on the heel for going down slippery hills. However, they run large. I bought my usual size (W8), and had looked at the size chart but have realized that I would do better in a 7 1/2. I can't lace them tight enough to keep from slipping around a bit and bigger socks are actually too warm. So, I recommend sizing down a bit when buying these.
review.name: Great waterproof hiking shoe - runs big

name: Ultra Flow GTX Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Excellent shoe! There very comfortable, supportive and have great grip.

review.reviewBody: I have been waiting to get this shoe in a US 14 for a long time. Finally restocked.  I like almost everything about this shoe except for the drop. It is not unbearable but I do find it to be less stable than my usual sense ride.  I wish you would consider making for styles in a US 14. I would definitely be interested in trying more styles. Thank you for listening to my concerns.

review.reviewBody: Great shoe, put 40k on them on the first two days of wear and my feet were happy throughout. Good traction for wet terrain and nice cushion. Could never where the speedcross for running because of shin splints with it, but this shoe is the perfect blend of cushion and traction.
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: Thundercross WOW! I have arthritis in my toes and find it hard to get a shoe that is comfortable, this shoe is so comfortable and helps me carry on hiking without the pain. 10*
review.name: Comfort

review.reviewBody: True to size as comfort. The customer service, from this company was outstanding.
review.name: Sweet

review.reviewBody: My daughter and I absolutely love this product! It has been a great addition to her shoe collection. At 4 years old she has no issues slipping it on and off herself. It has been the perfect shoe to wear by the beach / pool due to the water friendly capabilities. She also loves walking in it and wearing it to school. 10/10 recommend.
review.name: Great Kids Shoe

review.reviewBody: This shoe runs much smaller than previous Chaco shoes that I've bought. I usually wear a size 3 and there's usually room in the toe area. This time, the shoes stubbed my toes so much that it hurt and I had to return them asap. Very disappointed in the lack of size consistency and this has really turned me off from buying any of their shoes in the future. There is also so much fabric on top of the foot and it makes my feet really hot. Previous water shoe designs had more room for airflow and this one does not. Absolutely do not recommend these.
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: Shoes are very difficult to put on. They are difficult for my son and for me while helping him. They do stay on well while in the water though. But because they are so tough to put on my son doesn’t like to wear them.
review.name: Difficult to put on

review.reviewBody: Poorly designed shoe. The strap is held on by this tiny rope switch snapped in less than 10 times of my 2 year old wearing this shoe. There is no way this shoe holds up so anyone with this terrible design flaw. Waste of money, do not buy.
review.name: Terrible Design
comment: We're bummed to hear of your experience.  Have you reached out to our customer service team yet? Give the team a ring at 888.211.1908, we are here to help!

review.reviewBody: The viability of this shoe depends on a small length of hair elastic to put the straps in place. Of course the small piece of elastic broke pretty much immediately. I have not yet gotten around to asking for a refund.
review.name: faulty design
comment: We're bummed to hear of your experience.  Have you reached out to our customer service team yet? Give the team a ring at 888.211.1908, we are here to help!

review.reviewBody: The shoes are cute and my son thinks they're very comfortable however, the rubber band that holds the strap in place broke after just a couple weeks of wearing them and I'm afraid he won't get much more use out of them since the whole strap flops around and is no longer useful. The shoe itself seems durable so I'm very disappointed that the straps are already broken, especially at this price point.
review.name: Wish the straps were more durable...
comment: We're bummed to hear of your experience.  Have you reached out to our customer service team yet? Give the team a ring at 888.211.1908, we are here to help!

review.reviewBody: I like the Drifter shoes, but they are sized much smaller than the Chaco sandals…maybe even by two sizes
review.name: Size fit
comment: Thanks for sharing your feedback Becka!

review.reviewBody: My daughter loves these. Easy to put on, comfortable.
review.name: Great water shoes
comment: We're happy she loves them. Thanks for sharing Mike!

review.reviewBody:
I noticed riding more gravel and dirt trails near me that my bottles would always be covered in dust. Never fun having to put your mouth over a dusty bottle only to spit it out before having to drink. And in this day and age of covid, I don't think we should be spitting on trails even if you're away from everyone (no one's ever looked down at spit and was happy to see it).

So this bottle is perfect for gravel rides because the cap is rubber and comes off easily with a flick of the thumb. Yes the size isn't the largest, but that just seems to be the trend in bottle size. Hey bottle companies, how about just keep the 5 grams of making it larger and let us fill it less if we want? Haha whatever, it is what it is. If you know you need larger then don't get this bottle. However, if you want to keep dust out of your mouth, then this is a good bottle.

I'm going to take off one star because the top rubber part can be a little tricky to put on, especially one handed when you're on bumpy terrain. I would like to see a little heavier material there or less dangly of a top connector so you don't have to search for the top to put it back on. Then when inserting it back in the cage, if you don't put a finger on the top it can easily come off with an accidental rub. Still, it's not super hard to do, just I don't think the top is perfect as is.
review.name: Perfect to keep the dust out

review.reviewBody: Bought one based on 20 Oz. claim.  It barely holds 18 Oz.  Haven't used it yet.  Hopefully the valve lives up to claims.  Not worth the effort to return.
review.name: Undersized

review.reviewBody: The Dirt Series Podium 21oz Water Bottle by Camelbak works perfectly for my Specialized Turbo Levo frame.  I purchased two, one for me and another for my wife.  Sadly, after one ride the inside of one of the bottles came apart.  After just ONE use!  It's not cost effective to return the bottle so I guess I'll try to find another one and see what happens.  Great water bottle size for my frame, but a little disappointed by the lack of quality.
review.name: Water Bottle Fits Frame, However...

review.reviewBody: Perfect bottle for gravel riding—keeps the dirt and dust off.
review.name: Great bottle!

review.reviewBody: This new model of this bike bottle does not have the diameter required to fit securely in an universal water bottle cage as its predecessor model.  As a consequence, you can easily loose it on a bike ride and it also creates a rattle noise.
review.name: Loose fit in bike water bottle cage

review.reviewBody: Overly complex, leaves a full swallow of liquid in the bottle. That can only be obtained by removing the lid. Lid leaks when squeezed rapidly. Lost the dust cover on 1 bottle. And after 100 miles of riding I still haven't found a use for the locking mechanism.
review.name: Over engineered

review.reviewBody: Fits perfect in my carbon bottle holder.  No leaks, no dirt.  No weird taste, perfect.
review.name: Love it.  Just what i wanted

review.reviewBody: Best water bottle for MTB, keeps the dirt off the mouthpiece, water flows well, easy to use with one hand, and even has a locking mechanism for travel to the trail. Perfect!
review.name: Best MTB Water bottle

review.reviewBody: I have no idea what these ppl are talking about with their complaints of not being able to actuate the valve or disassemble it for cleaning.  Seriously. I'm only writing this review because I was irritated by how bad some ppl made it sound when it really is the best bottle I've ever used and it took me about 30 seconds to figure out how to take it apart.
review.name: My all time favorite bottle

review.reviewBody: Who would have thought?  Especially only riding in New York City.  But, I have to say, when I do reach down to grab, the dirt cap has dirt on it.  Hmm, than means without the cap, I would have been sucking on dirt.  I like it.  It gives me a reason to find the trail in Central Park.  It is not just about the loop ya know.
review.name: I like it!!!  The dirt cap is everything

name: Dirt Series Podium 21oz Water Bottle

review.itemreviewed: Climber's 3.0 Limited Edition Full-Zip Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: After buying several of the Castelli jerseys and wearing a XXL in most of them, I took a leap of faith here despite the previous reviews. Needless to say this jersey, while the quality appears to be there, the sizing is way off...2XL fits like a Large hence too tight of a fit. So back it goes and lesson learned.
review.name: Too small....

review.itemreviewed: Climber's 3.0 Limited Edition Full-Zip Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: The sizing seems way off.  I originally sized up and ordered an XL but then sized up 2 sizes to an XXL.. An XL might have worked, but felt a little too short.  I'm fairly thin, and the XXL still fits nice and snug.  Great construction and very comfortable and lightweight.   Perfect jersey for warm days!
review.name: Awesome Jersey

review.itemreviewed: Climber's 3.0 Limited Edition Full-Zip Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody: I returned as it was a little too skin-tight. However, it did say Climbing Jersey. It breathes well, comfortable, perfect for 80 degree + days. No collar and arms are extended. I would not recommend for every day rides but perfect for certain weather, lightweight.
review.name: Tight Fit, comfort for Warm Days, Climbs

review.itemreviewed: Climber's 3.0 Limited Edition Full-Zip Jersey - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This is a very nice jersey, no question at all. The description on the Castelli website mentions that it is modeled off of their aero race jersey (which I assumed meant the latest 6.0 version), so the fit (again, I assumed) should be the same between the Climber's 3.0 jersey and the Aero Race 6.0. I learned firsthand that this is not quite true.

The Aero Race 6.0 jersey is slightly shorter in the front and does not crinkle and bunch up very much when in the riding position. The same size Climber's 3.0 jersey creates three big "waves" along the length of the zipper whilst in the riding position. I'm 6 feet tall and 150 pounds and wear a size medium in both varieties. I'd buy this again if it was just a bit shorter in the front. Maybe a size small would be better.

Other than that one nitpicky gripe, this jersey is great.

It is very transparent and skintight, so be ready to either wear a summer base layer or show off your chest and stomach to everyone who looks at you because it's likely that you won't be hiding anything.
review.name: Good jersey but too long in the torso
comment: The last para sealed it for me. I have a belly so it's out for mua. Thank-you.

review.itemreviewed: Climber's 3.0 Limited Edition Full-Zip Jersey - Men's
review.name: Emotional roller-coaster!
comment: Wow! I never knew that buying a jersey was potentially so traumatic. Glad it worked out for you but this is way too complicated for someone with a simple mind like me.

name: Climber's 3.0 Limited Edition Full-Zip Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody: First time buying Danner shoes. It looks well made but is very narrow,. My guess is that 75% of men will need a wide shoe. Very lightweight without much support. Next time I will switch back to Keen.  It's a much better shoe
review.name: AVERAGE

review.reviewBody:
First Danner and possibly last if the quality of upper is any indication of rest of shoe.   Clearly a design flaw and bad material that is wasting way after 7 weekends of light use and about only 20 miles of hiking.

Light and comfortable.  Waterproofing seems adequate thus far but very suspect based on upper disinigrating.
review.name: Questionable quality.
comment:
Hey Adam
          Sorry the shoes arent working out for you.  we can always evaluate whether we can cover something like that under a warranty.  Please reach out if you need any assistance!

review.reviewBody:
I have had two pairs of the 2650 GTX.  

The good:
They are super comfortable. They will keep your feet dry.  They run true to size.  

The bad:
The first pair lasted 3 months before the stitching separated at the liner and the outer shell, right where you put your foot in. (Maybe there is a technical name for the foot hole, like an aglet). Backcountry promptly replaced them and I wrote it off as a bad pair.

The second pair lasted 18 months before displaying the same symptoms.  I still think they may be my favorite outdoor shoe, I just wish they lasted longer. I have come to expect more from Danner
review.name: Good shoe

review.reviewBody: I wear these at work and I stand most of the day or am moving around a lot on my feet.  Theses are pretty comfy and rarely do they bother my feet and if the do it is just for a short time so may just be my feet.  I think they look good and seem to be built pretty well.
review.name: Really good shoe.

review.reviewBody: I?ve been really impressed with the overall comfort of these shoes. They?re relatively lightweight , provide good arch support, and look good especially for a hiking shoe.
review.name: Comfortable Enough for Everyday Wear

review.reviewBody: Pleasantly surprised at the day long comfort of these shoes! I waited a month or so to post this review. In that time I?ve tried these shoes on day long treks in the Utah desert and throughout the Wasatch mountains. After finishing a 16-mile day hike which included rocks, stream crossings, and some snow trekking with crampons, I?m sold on the shoes. The tread provides moderate grip, and the gore Tex uppers repel water quite effectively. The support and comfort are superb! As I get older, I?m happy to have a little more cushion in my step. It?s early but the shoes are holding up well to all the abuse I?ve dished out. My only two criticisms are the insoles and the look. I did not like the insoles at all, but this is common for me and it may be due to the shape of my foot so I put the same insoles I put in all my backcountry footwear, that solved that problem. The last gripe might be just the eye of the beholder, but they look pretty lame to me. No matter, they carry me around just fine. Size 13, narrow feet, mid-high arches. I thought the sizing was true.
review.name: Not what I expected from Danner

review.reviewBody: These might be my favorite pair of shoes ever. I wear them in the snow, dirt, mud. I wear them running, walking, hiking and doing housework. They are incredibly comfortable and durable. Plus they are lightweight and weather resistant. I want to buy another pair.
review.name: Love these shoes

review.reviewBody:
It's been less than a month but I have nothing but great things to say about these shoes so far. In short: they are durable, comfortable, and fantastic for casual use or serious trials. These are the main points but read on if you like nitty-gritty gear details! (1)They are light. The lightest Danners ever actually.  "One pound on your feet equals five pounds on your back" to quote Sir Edmund Hillary after his Everest ascent in 1953. At 27 oz a pair (I measured the 9s I wore), I would expect something much more minimalist than this. Some sacrifice comfort or durability in their shoes to minimize weight. Instead, I was blown away by the performance and support in the arch and heel. These are light, breezy, and somehow still bomber hiking shoes. (2)	They're high performance. Vibram soles are deservedly associated with the very best hiking shoes and boots. They provide lasting comfort and great performance. The 2650s are no exception as the 460 outsoles paired with Megagrip rubber crush it out on all conditions. I did plenty of scrambling, hiked in wet and dry conditions, and was always impressed by the deep, multidirectional lugs. I experienced no slippage whatsoever. (3) They're Versatile. The styling and fit make these fit in on the trail or in the city. Though available with a mesh lining, I opted for the Goretex version of this shoe because I plan to spend time in the PNW where conditions are always wet. They ended up being great in the snow too! A goretex lining means you will have a waterproof and breathable shoe. I've taken them through mud, snow, and light rain no problem. However, if your feet sweat a lot, or you step in a deep puddle or water somehow splashes into the inside of your shoe, your feet will get wet. This is true of ANY waterproof shoe. What is not true of every waterproof shoe is that these breathe better than most other options. The 2650s ventilate very well though even in the upper 60s - avoiding sweaty, uncomfortable feet when hiking. (4) They're innovative. Aside from the main points above, this is the first heel counter on the outside of a shoe. The EXO heel system is meant to lock your heel in place. If your hiking shoes have even a little bit of slippage, blisters and discomfort tend to follow. I failed to notice a tangible difference in the external shank from other hiking shoes without it, but it can't hurt!
As far as personal experience, I broke these shoes in by wearing them to work and for walks with my dog around the neighborhood. Then, I road-tripped through Utah for just shy of 2 weeks. In Moab I went on many desert hikes. From relaxed .25 mile scenic walks in Arches to 1,500 feet of elevation gain over 4 miles on the Gooseberry Trail in Canyonlands I had no difficulties with these shoes. They remained unwaveringly stable and comfortable throughout. 
Then, I spent time in Bryce Canyon which had much more snow and mud on the trails than I expected! After encountering snow, ice, puddles, and oh so much mud, my feet were never cold or wet. I got up and down muddy/snowy trails just fine and with no wetting out. 
A few notes: Hard to speak with authority on durability as . If you plan to have much weight on your back I would opt for the mid version of these or a full boot. If you wont encounter wet conditions I might lean towards the non-gtx version for more breathability, however, I have yet to have a problem with clamminess even in the desert.
Sizing: I wear 8.5s in Eccos, 9 in Hokas, and 9.5 in Adidas and the 9s were perfect for me. My feet are vaguely narrow so if you run wide these might not be for you. I tend to order a half size up for hiking shoes as a lot of activity after a long day will make your feet swell this requiring more room.
Every inch of the shoe illuminates the thoughtful craft and care that Danner put into the design of this trusty trail shoe. 5/5 from me!
review.name: Gearhead Approved! New Go-To Hiking Shoe

review.reviewBody: The reservoir works fine, but I would like a plug and play cap with an integrated 42mm befree filter. The 28 mm filter is slow and while I can put it in a pocket to prevent freezing, the 42mm filter can just be left screwed on the seeker with water inside to prevent freezing. The 42mm filter is also better for quick day use on a flux 1L, but it's annoying trying to perfectly aim and squeeze a 42mm filter to fill up larger containers. Just a thought. The katadyn gravity befree has a plug and play screw on adapter for their befree filter and I may use that in the meantime.
review.name: It works, but could improve

review.reviewBody: Great product works as expected. It really needs a nylon bag to make it easier and quicker to hang up. I will make my own.
review.name: Great Product, needs a bag.

review.reviewBody: Great product for group backpacking and camping. Easy to use and maintain. Great features allow for multiple uses.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Love the product.Took it backpacking with me and it safe us from dehydration. Easy to use except one part - It's a little difficult to clean because the cap for cleaning fits only small lid bottles. I wish they made the cap that fits their seeker water bags.
review.name: Easy to use hard to clean

review.reviewBody: Bought this to take on a camping trip where the potable water was about a mile away so we wanted a large capacity to keep at the site. Held up great even after we left it hanging while full overnight. We didnt need the filter but glad to have it handy just in case.
review.name: Great water storage

review.reviewBody: I will be desert backpacking the end of August and will have to carry a lot of water with me. I purchased the clear 6L kit with the filter and tap. I also purchased a couple quick connects and hose then made my own gravity filter using a dark color Seeker 6L bag. The dark will be the dirty water and the clear the filtered clean bag. I won’t be able to use it in the backcountry for a couple months so I set it up at home and it filter 5L of clean tap water in only a couple minutes. I think it’s going to work I can’t wait to use it.
review.name: Seeker 6L Gravity System

name: Seeker + 6L Gravity Filter Kit

review.itemreviewed: Run Coolmax No-Show Tab Ultra-Light Cushion Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very high quality socks! These are ultralight though in the same way that Vermont is “hilly.” Which is to say that they might be ultralight by Darn Tough standards but they feel very thick to me. I will be keeping them for winter runs though as it gets down to the 50’s here and I might get cold feet! Usual outstanding Darn Tough quality and comfort, nice cushioning. I am not feeling a whole lot of mesh breathability, to be honest. They run true to size and as always I am sure are guaranteed for a long lifespan.
review.name: “Ultralight” is relative

name: Run Coolmax No-Show Tab Ultra-Light Cushion Sock - Women's

review.reviewBody: I’m happy with this helmet. It’s lightweight and had good ventilation.
review.name: Comfortable and light weight

review.reviewBody: Helmet fits head great and has amazing air flow. But what idiot designed the neck strap! Open to its full length a barely works. Would not recommend unless you have a scronny neck.
review.name: Good helmet

review.reviewBody:
The strap folds in on it self so many times that I have struggled to adjust it and see no way to cut the excess strap. 

The instruction book is microscopic. I am an experienced rider and don’t necessarily need a manual for a helmet, but like to see what the manufacture feels is the correct fitting. 

Feels a little snug compared to my other mediums.
review.name: Fits small- strap seems complicated

review.reviewBody: Medium in all other helmets and this was too small. Make sure to check fitment guide before ordering.
review.name: Fits small

review.reviewBody: Helmet fits great. Doesn’t have a huge mushroom head look to it. Doesn’t make me look super bald (even though I am). I like the high viz orange on the back. Only complaint is backcountry shipping. It used to be clockwork - 2 days - would show up on the third day. Last 3 things I ordered I get an email after 2 days saying “your package is arriving tomorrow” then it shows up 5-6 days later. More than a week after ordering. Seems like in the days of Prime, this is going the wrong direction.  My default is always to look in a local shop first, and this will make me more likely to spend that local shop premium. And then the fallback is Amazon I guess.
review.name: Helmet is great, backcountry not as much

review.reviewBody: Wanted a white helmet and this was the only one that comfortably fits me. All the others needed to be tightened to the point of pain to fit correctly for safety. This was the only one which doesn't have clamps digging into the back of my head. I sometimes forget I'm wearing it.
review.name: Finally found the right helmet

review.reviewBody: Looks good. Runs slightly on the small side.
review.name: Good value

review.reviewBody: I purchased my helmet about two months ago. I had a chance to ride with it a few times we had some spring days in the north east is actually still winter, but it was nice just to get out and ride. The quality of the helmet is excellent fit was perfect right out the box didn’t have to adjust anything except for the chinstrap the Helmet stay put locking system it’s superb The helmet is true to size just be sure to measure before you buy, and you will have a custom fit I Highly recommend this helmet
review.name: Fit

review.reviewBody: The Omne Air Mips Helmet was packaged securely and was delivered on time. The helmet fits great and is much lighter than the helmet I have been wearing for several years. The Omne helmet design allows for improved air flow, which is great for riding in hot weather.
review.name: Omne Air Mips Helmet

name: Omne Air Mips Helmet

description: Buy the Nite Ize TagLit Rechargeable Magnetic LED Marker online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: TagLit Rechargeable Magnetic LED Marker
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nite Ize TagLit Rechargeable Magnetic LED Marker online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought one and got another when I entered a run.  They are perfect - they slip right into the tab at the back of my shoes.  I get lots of compliments on them.  The ones I have are not rechargeable and I've had them since 2021.  I am ordering the rechargeable for other family members.
review.name: Great for running

review.reviewBody: Easy to recharge. No batteries is a big selling point.
review.name: No batteries

review.reviewBody:
I love the concept and quality of this little marker light.  For my specific needs though it needs a little tweaking.  I purchased four of the TagLit lights to mark tarp guy lines at night while camping.  
For this application, when the light is constantly on it is quite bright. I don't require the light to be so bright. A very low light setting would be great.  Just a glow would be awesome.  Also for a marker light it blinks way too fast. It is more of a strobe light than it is a marker light. It flashes approximately twice a second. I would prefer once every two or three seconds.
Also these suggestions would increase the battery life considerably, which would save having to recharge as often.
Of course these are all my personal opinions. I do like the light overall.
review.name: My Input...

review.reviewBody: Purchased this newer model/version and it comes with a hard plastic back which made it heavier and a little cumbersome.  The magnets weren't as powerful as the previous model and had a hard time getting it clasped onto thicker clothing.  Ironically enough, I lost it as it fell off shirt when taking off a raincoat.  Not bad...but not as good as the previous in my opinion.
review.name: Preferred previous model - NITEIZE-TGL-35-R3

review.reviewBody: As somebody who does a lot of his runs at night, I find the rechargeable TagLit to be very useful.  It could't be simpler to charge and use, and it's a nice bright tag to alert others of your presence when out getting some exercise after dark.
review.name: Great Light ID for Evening Exercise

name: TagLit Rechargeable Magnetic LED Marker
