review.reviewBody: Stealth rubber is known for being super grippy and I definitely felt that but the sizing is atrocious. Climbing shoes are generally hard to size but you'd expect within a brand that things would stay consistent. I normally wear a half size smaller with adidas shoes but even a half size above my normal size these were too tight.
review.name: Great shoe, terrible sizing

review.reviewBody: Brought for a friend although pricy are worth the pennies
review.name: Very decent purchase

review.reviewBody:
Purchased as a go to all rounder. Love climbing in them. A little discomfort though but my own fault for downsizing a little bit. If buying, get your street shoe size.
Probably didn’t last as long as I’d have thought once I started going outside in the good weather though.
The synthetic material holds foot smells quite badly and isn’t very breathable. Store outside a bag, rinse regularly and boot bananas are a must. If you like climbing with other people.
review.name: Grippy all rounder, fragile, smelly

review.reviewBody: After 8 months being in climbing and lot of research on buying shoes for first time. Seniors' advice and budget lead me to these phenomenal pair of shoes.
review.name: Best Beginner's Shoes at Reasonable Price

review.reviewBody:
The sizing runs small. And the wide is mid.
I had to exchange twice to get the right fit.
review.name: Good climbing shows for beginners.

review.reviewBody: I've been an Anasazi fan for about 10 years of climbing. I tried two different sizes of this shoes and they both fit really weird. My toes are crunched against the front, but there's a large gap above my foot in the shoe. I typically wear size 11.5 US shoes and have a long, narrow foot. I was hoping that these were just the Anasazi with a different name, but the different fit has me looking for another all purpose shoe unfortunately. I was really bummed they've changed so much. 1 star might be unfair just because they're not their predecessor, but I wasn't sure how to rate them having not climbed with them.
review.name: Weird Fit

review.reviewBody:
I see other reviews saying this is a good shoe for wide feet, and that's crazy talk! 

I have an old pair of by BELOVED FiveTen Anasazi Verde's which fit me SO good. I put them up against a pair of my new NIADs and the NIADS are almost a full centimeter narrower! I don't feel like I have wide feet, just normal. And these shoes, while still a nice shoe are uncomfortably narrow, while still fitting the length correctly. 

I'm disappointed they have changed. I was hoping this would be my go-to shoe and now it's not. Other than the narrow fit they are still a good shoe, and I may try and use them some, just not in great comfort, and I have to find a different shoe for my first choice now.
review.name: Narrow!

review.reviewBody: Fits great for bigger feet and high volume feet. Though my foot is wide. It was still a good show to fit in
review.name: Great fitting shoe for high volume feet

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] great fit if you prefer laces over velcro.
my first time wearing 510, it was worth the switch.
review.name: solid purchase

name: Niad Lace Climbing Shoe

description: Buy the Silca T-Ratchet + Ti-Torque Kit online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: T-Ratchet + Ti-Torque Kit
hasVariant.description: Buy the Silca T-Ratchet + Ti-Torque Kit online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have had two of these the first one the ratchet failed and a friend of mine got me a new one for my birthday.  He used it for both bike packing and reassembling bikes after a trip on the airplane, and a light or use around the garage on the bike maintenance although I do use a Park tool torque wrench for bigger jobs.
The second one I got the ratchet also failed at this time. I contacted customer support with Silca and they sent me a new one right away, which looks to be slightly different than the previous model, but it hasn’t failed yet. The new one also had an updated torque wrench that had larger numbers and a larger barrel for easier reading because the original was really difficult to see
The second problem I have is the magnets are kind of weak and at one point it fell apart while I was reaching to tighten a stem and actually chipped my paint due to the fairly heavy pieces that make up the extensions. 
I really like the fit and finish and the bit seem really be nice quality haven’t had any issues with it stripping any heads of the bolts. My big problem is the weak magnets which are very problematic and keeping the longer pieces together. The bag is also really well built and but a little on the heavy side I would like to see that made of a lighter fabric.  I have really mixed feelings about this cause it’s such a pretty little tool but for the price I do think that there’s probably better options for the price.  This one is staying in my toolbox, but most likely I probably won’t take it with me on any more trips.  I picked up a Topeak torque stick with a couple bit extensions that I’m gonna stick in my bike box for future use..
review.name: Really nice, but needs to be updated

review.reviewBody: This is now the most revered tool in my box. It is the handiest, snappiest torque wrench in the history of torque wrenches. Get it immediately and have piece of mind your bolts are correctly cinched.
review.name: The Tool of Tools

review.reviewBody: The ratchet that came with this product failed the first time I used it. Tightening some bolts to 5Nm the ratchet locked up and then started slipping completely. I contacted Silca and they sent a replacement. This ratchet also failed after a couple uses and again I contacted Silca for a replacement hoping that maybe my luck was really that bad. The third ratchet has no failed yet, but also does not function smoothly. At this point I don't trust the tool at all, and will not take it with me on bikepacking trips. I have replaced the ratchet with a fix-it-stick, modular t-wrench. Very disappointed in my first Silca purchase.
review.name: Faulty Ratchet

review.reviewBody: I was excited to get this because I really like the fit, finish and versatility of this torque wrench.  It is very well made and offers many options for working on my bikes.  However, the internal mechanism (ratchet pawls) that catch the ratchet are faulty. There are a few that don’t catch completely causing the mechanism to skip when applying pressure. For this price I would think it would have much better quality control, especially with the internal mechanism, which is so important. I am sadly returning it.
review.name: Was excited, but disappointed

review.reviewBody: The bits are machined very well and sit snuggly in their respective holders when using the tools.  It's a little bit bulkier than other similar products, but it's much nicer.  I find myself using it at home quite often.
review.name: Works perfectly!

review.reviewBody: Its good but the handle does not stay inside so it drops all the time when you use it. For this money you would expect it to work perfect.
review.name: Could use some improvements

name: T-Ratchet + Ti-Torque Kit

review.reviewBody: First real good shorts I have ever owned. It makes quite a difference, especially in 100+ mile rides. I like the compression.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: It's too early to weigh in on the quality and durability of these shorts. I had to return the first pair because they were too small. My fault. So I measured myself twice to make sure I picked the right size the second time around. They fit me but they are less than spacious at the front. I wore them to a 45 minute spinning class and couldn't wait to get them off. Most uncomfortable. Perhaps I should have gone for the next size up. Too late now.
review.name: Tight at the front despite measuring

review.reviewBody:
i ordered Medium, based n the charts ( 33" waist, 6', 185# ).
they take a little more effort to pull on than i expected. They're OK, but I would have probably liked the Large a little better.
very good quality for the price, however.
review.name: little bit snug

review.reviewBody: I wear these MTN biking. I love them. Bought 2 pair. Might by more. Super comfortable, stable and plenty of cushion.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Not overly padded and just the right amount of compression for 50+ mile rides. Medium fits good on my 5-11" and 173 pound frame.
review.name: Nice Shorts

review.reviewBody: Just Super Comfy for long rides.
review.name: The most comfortable bike shorts

review.reviewBody: These seem ok overall, pretty standard as far as cycling shorts go, but they have a really high waist, which makes it uncomfortable, with extra material when in the riding position. Previous versions of this specialized shorts are cut better.
review.name: Oddly high waist

review.reviewBody:
very confortable .
nice product
review.name: great !

review.reviewBody: I have several Peak Design bags for different occasions, with the compatibility of the V2 cubes my gear is ready to go in whichever bag I need at the moment, just plug and play!
review.name: Quick and easy

review.reviewBody:
This pack is fantastic. I can fit all my cameras into an organized place where when I am traveling it fits perfectly into my Pelican Airbase so that I can Roll my camera equipment through Airports and Train-stations where the rugged case protects my equipment and locks easily.  Then when I get to my destination can simply lift the contents and place into my Peak Design travel case (which I carry on my back during flights and such but rather than filled with heavy Camera equipment I fill with Computer, Clothes, shoes, etc that I will need for my trip). when arriving in the destination its very easy to unpack the clothing (also in compartmentalized cases) and head straight out with Camera in the Back pack for ease of use... 
Changed my packing and traveling routine...
review.name: Efficient Packing of Camera Equipment for Travel

review.reviewBody:
The cameracubes are just what I needed. I have two and keep my gear in them. One with the gear I use most when travelling and one with the rest. When I go on a trip I just pack the one cube in my (peak design) backpack and off I go.
Everything easy to find, everything efficiently packed. Am a huge fan
review.name: Just what I needed

review.reviewBody: I bought the various size cubes with the 25L and 45 L outdoor backpacks. They are very versatile
review.name: Very well built and practical

review.reviewBody: Fits into the Everyday Backpack (20l), doesn‘t lose anything in the backpack and can be taken separately. Everything perfect!
review.name: Perfect for Eyeryday-Equipment

review.reviewBody: Got this with he 7L sling bag, fits great and works well for a small mirorless camera (an Olympus) as as well a film camera as long as it and the eons isn't that big, I carry an Olympus OM 1 film camera as well.
review.name: Perfect size

review.reviewBody: I purchased this as part of the Outdoor Line Kickstarter to go with my 7L Sling and I have to say, it's really perfect for my needs. It fits very well within the sling and instantly gives the sling the protection it needs to make a great on the go carrier for my camera, a few lenses, and even room for a few miscellaneous items as well. It even comes with a few clips to be a bag on its own if needed. 10/10!
review.name: Packable, portable, perfect

review.reviewBody: I received the large cube last month and have changed my layout until I found what works best for me.  I love how I can change the layout for when I get new lenses.
review.name: Love the versatility, especially the side access.

review.reviewBody: Tolle Ergänzung zu meiner Fotoausrüstung. So kann man im Urlaub passgenau für die einzelnen Touren das Equipment zusammenstellen und das nicht benötigte wird in der Basis belassen…
review.name: Kompaktes Packgenie

review.reviewBody: Everything that I need to secure in my carryon fits in this bag. Nikon z7ii body with 3 lenses
review.name: Perfect fit for light travel setup

review.reviewBody: What more could you ask for! Love this jacket from cold evenings at the beach to a day on the ski slopes.

I've worn this jacket everyday this winter for casual wear, travel, snow, and skiing. I like the fit, the fleece pockets, and that it's lightweight (I gave it 9/10 because there are lighter jackets out there).
review.name: This is a good looking go to jacket for any winter weather

review.reviewBody: I really love this jacket. I’ve taken it out in the snow in Washington as well as into the Wasatch mountains of Utah and it keeps me absolutely warm and toasty! The reinforced shoulders definitely kept me dry in the rain and the nice fabric lined pockets were a nice warm place to stow my hands. It packs easily into its own pocket which is nice when traveling. Highly recommend this jacket.
review.name: Great jacket!

review.reviewBody: I back pack a lot and layering is the best way to stay warm if you do it correctly. I layered this jacket with a merino wool base layer and a fleece and then the down jacket and I was good for temps around 20. I am 6’6 and slim and ordered a large and it was long enough.
review.name: Pretty dang warm

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this jacket for several months and it’s okay. Good material but the sizing is odd and very boxy. Torso length is short and it says the model is 6ft wearing a medium but that’s just somebody standing still and not using the jacket actively
review.name: Box size

review.reviewBody: Great lightweight coat and I love the added waterproof hood/shoulders. Nice touch for those wet days when I want the warmth but need to keep the rain/snow off. My previous puffy did not have this and was constantly getting wet. It’s definitely  a slimmer fit around the middle so it will keep me in check from getting too fat and lazy this winter.
review.name: Just the right light weight

review.reviewBody: Sleek look - professional but sporty. Warm. Tough - my Giant Schnauzer Puppy jumps on me several times a day and no tears.
review.name: Warm, Great fit Down Jackie/Hoodie

review.reviewBody: I wear it daily up here in Alaska. It keeps me warm and water resistant shoulders/ head keeps me dry. Also, it has held up well against the brush where lesser jackets would’ve resulted in tears.
Its a great packable. I would say it’s slightly small and or more form fitting

I’ve been wearing this jacket heavily for the past 3 years and love it. Very little down lost through the seams over the years, much better than I can say about some of the later Patagonia down products. Very warm, the water resistant shoulders help a ton, and can often be purchased on sale. Will likely replace with the same if I ever need to.
review.name: Perfect go-to puffer

name: Helium Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
Outdoor Research - SS24 - PDP Videos - ODRZ8AP - Helium Down Hooded Jacket - Men's

Buy the Outdoor Research Trail Mix Beanie online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Trail Mix Beanie
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Trail Mix Beanie online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is my new go-to for fall and winter walks and hikes. It absorbs sweat and dries super fast and keeps my head warm enough without overheating. Beautiful bluish-teal color too. I ordered a small and it was true to size and fit my small head snugly.
review.name: Love this beanie!

review.reviewBody: So comfortable, very soft fabric, perfect for cold weather
review.name: Vert good choice

review.reviewBody: Cool hat for my cooler Son. I want one for myself. maybe Father's Day
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I like the fabric and the extra-long length of the hat. A lot of beanies are now extremely short and don't provide good ear or forehead coverage. I do wish that the OR logo was on the side or back of the hat. It's too prominent in the front, just over your face!
review.name: A fine hat with one thing I would change.

review.reviewBody: It's warm but breathes when you move, and I find it stylish. It's a fairly deep, so of you want something just sitting on your head, that's not it.
review.name: Great beanie for outdoor activities

review.reviewBody: Good design and seems durable. Comfortable fit. Price is right.
review.name: Fits well, durable, warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I loved this beanie. Initially I thought it might be too thin for the real cold, but it's perfect. The cuff also helps adapt to sweat or frost around the bottom. Never got too hot and adjusted super well to chills while running in the snow at 8k Ft in Colorado.
review.name: Great Beanie

review.reviewBody: I needed a replacement beanie for cool weather and evenings at camp. This was the perfect selection. It's lightweight, incredibly comfortable, and warm. I live in Illinois and I wouldn't (won't) wear it when it's the middle of winter and it's really cold but when it's slightly below freezing through to low 60s, this is the perfect hat. 10/10 would buy it again but, then again, I've never had a sub-par OR product
review.name: Soft, warm, and comfortable - a perfect beanie

review.reviewBody: I have a big head and was concerned that the L/XL wouldn't fit but it was great! I used it cold weather camping and it was perfect, even while hauling a sled of gear I didn't overheat. And what moisture I did have dried quickly, which is huge for me.
review.name: Great fitting and warm!

name: Trail Mix Beanie

review.reviewBody: I live in various sun shirts during the summer, have all brands, and this one is my favorite. I do not overheat, it's true to size and has the most flattering fit of all my sun shirts. Please keep making these and some more colors would be awesome!
review.name: Great sun shirt!

review.reviewBody: Love the fit, color and soft texture. I wore it on a long bike ride on a sunny summer day and on each hike on a trip through utah’s national parks. It kept the sun off and kept me cooler in the intense sun. I really like the shirt and the sleeve length is perfect for my long arms.  I wore it only about 5 times before it started getting holes in the middle of the fabric thats around my hands but not on seams. I wasn't grabbing anything with the shirt just using it to block sun and sometimes rain. Kinda bummed that it’s getting holes already after so few wears. I only washed it once so far. Overall still love it though just wish it had lasted more than a few wears.
review.name: Almost

review.reviewBody: Good fit true to size. Sleeve length is great. No pulling on your shoulders when using the thumb holes in the sleeves. Overall long length covers bum. Very comfortable. I got the blue top and it was true to the color on the model. Very well made.
review.name: Love it! Need more colors

review.reviewBody:
I bought 4 of these sun shirts last year. They fit perfectly and the quality is great.

Don’t fix it if it’s not broke…I bought 3 of these this year, and the threads are visibly coming undone after wearing twice. Plus, the sizes are way different than last year.
review.name: Poor Quality

review.reviewBody: The color looks amazing and it feels really lightweight when you have it on. I haven't been able to test out the SPF rating as it's fall now, but I'm sure it will work perfectly in the summer months. It does run a bit small, so I was happy I got a medium!
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this Sun shirt after reading many online comments about it. I sizes up as I like a bit looser fit. Please make more colors for 2024/2025
review.name: Love this sunshirt

review.reviewBody: I took two with me for a 5 day backpacking trip at 10,000 ft and LOVED them. Excellent sun protection while keeping me cool (enough) and quick drying. Definitely thicker than other sun hoodies I’ve tried, but I like the feel (more durable than most) and doesn’t seem to hold on to a lot of odor. My only wish is that the hood had a hole for a ponytail! Now these are both my go to outdoor shirts.
review.name: Awesome Sunhoodie

review.reviewBody: This is a great shirt for any activity. I use it for hiking, boating, and gardening. The material is a perfect weight for hot weather and  it dries quickly if it gets wet. The sleeve thumb holes allow sun protection for the top of your hands. The hood is comfortable and shades the head well.
review.name: First rate sun protection

review.reviewBody: Literally the best shirt I've ever owned.
review.name: Literally the best shirt ever

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this top, ordered 1 in all the colors, super light weight, keeps me cool during long bike rides as I commute all summer. finger holes for hand coverage and hood are lovely, just need in more colors. would love a bubblegum pink, turquoise, lavender, red clay color.
review.name: perfect summer top, need more colors !!

name: Tahoe Sun Hoodie - Women's
